body_html:
I did use a brand new install of Xubuntu 18.04, Bionic Beaver.
Brand new! No dirt - nothing.
Then I updated the system and installed CUDA 9.2 and cuDNN v7.2.1.
See here for a step by step guide written by myself: https://wiki.eniak.de/ml/cuda_unter_ubuntu_installieren

I installed tensorflow-gpu with conda via conda install tensorflow-gpu. That installed tensorflow-gpu 1.10.0.

Now everything was working fine and smooth.

When I installed CUDA 9.1 or CUDA 9.0 (which I did before) I got this error:
CUDA driver version is insufficient for CUDA runtime Version

Maybe here is the difference: I did use conda and not pip but I do not think this is a big difference.

@tfboyd I am 100% sure about the version numbers...
I am very confused and can send more details tomorrow. Just ask what you need to know...

body:
I did use a brand new install of Xubuntu 18.04, Bionic Beaver.
Brand new! No dirt - nothing.
Then I updated the system and installed CUDA 9.2 and cuDNN v7.2.1.
See here for a step by step guide written by myself: https://wiki.eniak.de/ml/cuda_unter_ubuntu_installieren

I installed `tensorflow-gpu` with conda via `conda install tensorflow-gpu`. That installed  tensorflow-gpu 1.10.0.

Now everything was working fine and smooth.

When I installed CUDA 9.1 or CUDA 9.0 (which I did before) I got this error:
CUDA driver version is insufficient for CUDA runtime Version

Maybe here is the difference: I did use conda and not pip but I do not think this is a big difference.

@tfboyd I am 100% sure about the version numbers...
I am very confused and can send more details tomorrow. Just ask what you need to know...
